snippet: The Internal Revenue Service and the Justice Department have announced in recent months that they will no longer use the practice of civil forfeiture, though the repeal does not apply retroactively.
abstract: Convenience store owner Lyndon McLellan in rural Fairmont, NC, is trying to recover $107,702 seized by IRS for so-called structuring of bank deposits; IRS and Justice Dept have said they are no longer pursuing asset forfeiture in non-criminal cases, though repeal does not apply retroactively.
lead_paragraph: The Internal Revenue Service and the Justice Department have announced in recent months that they will no longer use the practice of civil forfeiture, though the repeal does not apply retroactively.

headline.main: Rules Change on I.R.S. Seizures, Too Late for Some
